titleStmt.title: George E. Roe et al. to Unknown
CWG9423

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To his Excellency the Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky,
Whereas at the ^October^ April Term of the Carter Circuit Court 18610. Hiram Lansdown of the Carter County was tried for the offense of keeping a tipling house and fine the Sum of $20,00

Mr Lansdown, was fine under the following circumstances, he was a distiller & sold one or two quarts of Liquor of his own manufacture, and not on the premasis or adjacent thereto, and we the under Signed citizens of carter county being familiar with the above facts, respectfully ask that so much of said fine as can be remited by his Excellency. Shall be done as Lansdown is a gentleman with a family, and in humble circumstances

Geo. E. Roe Atty for Greenup County. I know the above facts are true as I Defendended Lansdown upon his trial
John T. Ratcliff
James Blevins
Charles Remy
Martin Gillum
J. Johnson
